alert.note: Alert for Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; McCreary; Owsley; Perry; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:07PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Laurel, Bell, Knox, central Owsley, western Leslie, northwestern Perry, southern Jackson, eastern McCreary, Whitley, southwestern Breathitt and Clay Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 907 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bond to near Strunk. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Maulden, Zekes Point, Egypt, Herd, Tyner, Shepherdtown, Nathanton, Malcomb, High Knob and Welchburg around 915 PM EDT. Sextons Creek, Sourwood, Island City, Chestnutburg, Sacker Gap, Blake, Burning Springs, Laurel Creek, Sturgeon and Treadway around 920 PM EDT. Red Ash, Trixie, Saxton, Lot, Felty, Thomas, Taff, Teges, Mountain Ash and Conkling around 925 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Newfound, Mistletoe, Sebastian, Gobbard, Polly Camp, Packard, Ricetown, Oneida, Gatliff, Nevisdale, Valjean, Pearl, Wilkerson, Frakes, Morris Fork, Lucky Fork, Dalesburg, Whoopflarea, Saul, Siler, Buckhorn, Fonde, Buckhorn Lake S.P., Pruden, Beech, Chenoa, Shoal, Crockettsville, Talbert, Kaliopi, Middlesboro, Chavies, Noetown, Krypton, Gays Creek, Barwick, Bush Branch, Altro, Mosley Bend and Binghamtown. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 48. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 47. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 4 and 11. U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 26. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Leslie; McCreary; Owsley; Perry; Whitley
